newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Corimon trades on bolsa as CRMa.CR CRMb.CR.
newsitem.headline: Corimon trades on bolsa as CRMa.CR CRMb.CR.

text.p: Venezuelan paints and packaging company Corimon now trades on the Caracas stock exchange under the tickers CRMa.CR and CRMb.CR, the Caracas bolsa said.
The A and B shares are the fruit of a financial restructuring that left the company's former common stocks as A shares, and securitized debt now traded as preferred B shares.
Corimon A shares, which began trading Monday in Caracas after an eight-month suspension, will also trade on the New York Stock Exchange when the New York ban is lifted, the bolsa said.
The company currently has 1,111,056,490 A shares and 2,601,471,718 B shares outstanding, each at a nominal ten bolivars.
A shares rose 0.10 bolivars to close at 18.10 in Tuesday's session, while B shares dropped to 12.75 after opening at 16.50 bolivars.
